H3.text: when did krakow become the capital of poland. 1038

A4.text: In 1038, Kraków became the seat of Polish monarchs from the Piast dynasty.

A5.text: In 1038, Kraków became the seat of Polish monarchs from the Piast dynasty, and subsequently served as the centre of administration under Jagiellonian kings and of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth until the late 16th century, when Sigismund III transferred his royal court to Warsaw.
